sameAnalysis.word_list: string, rope, line, cord, thread, wire
means: string ： 普通用词，指捆绑小件物品的细绳或细带子。
rope ： 指用于捆绑大物件的粗壮而坚固的绳子，一般用绵、毛、麻、金属或其它材料制成。
line ： 普通用词，含义广泛，指任何一种线，常作引申用。
cord指比string粗，比rope细，较牢固，通常用于捆扎较小物品的线或绳。用作引申当约束讲。
thread ： 普通用词，指用棉、毛、丝或纤维等纹成的很细的线，通常用于缝纫、纺织等。
wire ： 专指用金属制成的线。

sentence.Network_en: A thin, glistening thread of moisture ran along the rough concrete sill.
sentence.Network_cn: 在粗糙不平的水泥窗台上有一条细细的发光水印。

sentence.Network_en: She idly pulled at a loose thread on her skirt.
sentence.Network_cn: 她无聊地扯着裙子上一根松掉的线头。

sentence.Network_en: A ratchet mechanism transfers the thread from spool to bobbin.
sentence.Network_cn: 一种棘齿装置把线从线轴转到梭心上。

jx.jx_en_mean: be in a highly precarious state
be unable to follow what someone is saying or remember what one is going to say next

means.word_mean: 穿线入孔,把线或绳编成辫状

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English thrǣd (noun), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch draad and German Draht, also to the verb throw. The verb dates from late Middle English

entry.def: Thread or a thread is a long very thin piece of a material such as cotton, nylon, or silk, especially one that is used in sewing.

example.ex: This time I'll do it properly with a needle and thread.
example.tran: 这次，我要用针线将它缝好。

example.ex: ...a tiny Nepalese hat embroidered with golden threads.
example.tran: 带有金丝线刺绣的尼泊尔小帽

entry.def: The thread of an argument, a story, or a situation is an aspect of it that connects all the different parts together.

example.ex: The thread running through many of these proposals was the theme of individual power and opportunity...
example.tran: 贯穿这许多提案的主线是个人权力和机遇这一主题。

example.ex: All religions are united by the common threads of fighting evil and helping others...
example.tran: 所有宗教都因为惩恶助人这一共同主题而联合起来。

entry.def: A thread of something such as liquid, light, or colour is a long thin line or piece of it.

example.ex: A thin, glistening thread of moisture ran along the rough concrete sill.
example.tran: 在粗糙不平的水泥窗台上有一条细细的发光水印。

example.ex: ...Venetian glass decorated with embedded threads of white.
example.tran: 镶嵌有白色线条的彩色装饰玻璃

entry.def: You can refer to clothes as threads .

example.ex: ...a cheap place to pick up natty threads.
example.tran: 能买到既整洁时髦而又便宜的衣服的去处

entry.def: The thread on a screw, or on something such as a lid or a pipe, is the raised spiral line of metal or plastic around it which allows it to be fixed in place by twisting.

example.ex: The screw threads will be able to get a good grip.
example.tran: 螺纹能牢牢地咬合卡紧。

entry.def: If you thread your way through a group of people or things, or thread through it, you move through it carefully or slowly, changing direction frequently as you move.

example.ex: Slowly she threaded her way back through the moving mass of bodies...
example.tran: 她从人流中慢慢地挤了回来。
我们在小船中间蜿蜒穿行

entry.tran: 使(细长的物体)穿过;使穿进
entry.def: If you thread a long thin object through something, you pass it through one or more holes or narrow spaces.

example.ex: ...threading the laces through the eyelets of his shoes...
Air ducts and electrical cables were threaded through the complex structure...
example.tran: 通风管和电缆在这幢结构复杂的建筑物中穿过。

entry.def: If you thread small objects such as beads onto a string or thread, you join them together by pushing the string through them.

example.ex: Wipe the mushrooms clean and thread them on a string.
example.tran: 把这些蘑菇擦干净，然后用线穿起来。

entry.def: When you thread a needle, you put a piece of thread through the hole in the top of the needle in order to sew with it.

example.ex: I sit down, thread a needle, snip off an old button.
example.tran: 我坐下来，穿好针，剪下一枚旧纽扣。

entry.def: If you say that something is hanging by a thread, you mean that it is in a very uncertain state and is unlikely to survive or succeed.

example.ex: The fragile peace was hanging by a thread as thousands of hardliners took to the streets.
example.tran: 成千上万的强硬派分子走上街头示威，脆弱的和平局势危在旦夕。

entry.tran: (活动中断后)继续下去/(经历失败、霉运后)恢复生机
entry.def: If you pick up the threads of an activity, you start it again after an interruption. If you pick up the threads of your life, you become more active again after a period of failure or bad luck.

example.ex: Many women have been able to pick up the threads of their former career.
example.tran: 许多女性得以重操旧业。

means.word_mean: 1. a fine cord of twisted fibers (of cotton or silk or wool or nylon etc.) used in sewing and weaving
2. any long object resembling a thin line;

sentences.sentence: "from the air the road was a gray thread"

means.word_mean: 3. the connections that link the various parts of an event or argument together;

sentences.sentence: "I couldn't follow his train of thought"
"he lost the thread of his argument"

means.word_mean: 4. the raised helical rib going around a screw
1. to move or cause to move in a sinuous, spiral, or circular course;

sentences.sentence: "sometimes, the gout wanders through the entire body"

means.word_mean: 3. remove facial hair by tying a fine string around it and pulling at the string;
5. thread on or as if on a string;

sentences.sentence: "the child drew glass beads on a string"

sentences.en: There is a consistent thread running through all these policies.
sentences.cn: 所有这些政策中贯穿着一条始终如一的主线。
这孩子用线把珠子串起来。

jushi.english: To sew a button on, you need a needle and thread.
The thread is formed into a ball.
The spider hung by a thread.
